wikipedia_page.main:
Major Sir Lancelot Ernest Curran (8 March 1899 – 20 October 1984) was a Northern Ireland High Court judge and parliamentarian.
He was elected as Ulster Unionist Member of Parliament for Carrick in the Stormont Parliament serving from 1945–49, and was Parliamentary Secretary to the Minister of Finance (Chief Whip) (17 July 1945 - 12 June 1947).Curran was Attorney General for Northern Ireland (6 June 1947 – 4 November 1949), the youngest in the history of that parliament. He was a member of the Orange Order and became a member of the Privy Council of Northern Ireland.

response: * Lancelot Curran (1899–1984), Northern Ireland High Court judge and parliamentarian

* Lancelot Curran

In 1952, one of Northern Ireland's most controversial murders took place in Whiteabbey when Patricia Curran, the 19-year-old daughter of prominent judge and politician Sir Lancelot Curran, was found stabbed near her home, Glen House.

link_mentions.page: Chronology of Provisional Irish Republican Army actions (1970–1979)
response: *26 July: The IRA bombed the homes of the Rev. Martin Smyth and Lord Justice Lancelot Curran. Nobody was injured in either attack.
|rowspan="3"|Lancelot Curran
* Booker-nominated The Blue Tango (London, Faber & Faber, 2001), which examined the murder of Lancelot Curran's 19-year-old daughter, Patricia Curran

* Blue Is the Night (published in 2014), which deals with the involvement of Lancelot Curran in a murder trial in the Northern Ireland of the late 1940s. Blue Is the Night won the 2015 Kerry Group Irish Novel of the Year.
* 12 November – Murder of Patricia Curran, 19-year-old daughter of Sir Lancelot Curran. Iain Hay Gordon was found guilty of her murder, but the sentence was overturned in 2000.
